hackathon-description-text: The Agile Youth Challenge is a programming hackathon/codeathon competition for students in grades 6-12, at any NYC or area school, with any level of programming experience.
hackathon-eligibility: Middle School and High School students from any NYC area school can participate. Teams must be accompanied by an adult sponsor.
hackathon-rules:
Your team will develop a solution to a problem in any language / technology of your choice. You'll work with partners, in sprints, throughout the day. By the end of the day your team will create a working prototype of your solution. 
You can use any technology to solve the problem. Platforms could include desktop, web, and/or mobile; languages could include Java, Objective C, Swift, PHP, Processing, Scratch, Snap!, C#, or any others; physical devices could include computers, tablets, mobile devices, robots, boards, droids, spaceships… If you bring it, you can use it.
The majority of your product must be created by your team on Sunday. You are welcome to pull code from repositories, use APIs, and even repurpose your own or others' prior code with proper attribution. But the bulk of your work should be done on Sunday. 
At the end of the day you'll present your work to the judges. If you are selected as a winner you'll present your project to everyone. Prizes will be awarded for several levels of age and ability, as well as a single audience favorite. And everyone will take home some great swag (physical and digital) donated by our supporters.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Codesters shirts
Codesters stickers & pins
Codesters - "how to pitch an idea" workshop
GCT - summer internship
GCT - shadow Eddie for a day - 2 teams
C/I - two teams join us at NYTM on December 15th
C/I - Kickstarter Office Tour for two-four teams on January 12
C/I - swag - Metal water bottles & C/I t-shirts for one team

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Website, Azure account - show that you've done it, and get MS swag to boot!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Microsoft - Dreamspark challenge + swag
Microsoft - winning team gets lunch w/ James + office visit Q/A
Microsoft - runner up - 4gb flash drives & universal chargers
Microsoft - game/mouse/water bottles/t-shirts for best tweet or instagram
Samsung - prize bags

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Ideal for a project that involves some sort of B2B / B2C marketing element. (I don't know much about bit coins...) Time/date/location TBD in conversation with Lucky Diem.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Lucky Diem - in-person or virtual meeting to discuss the project's business model, product/market fit, etc.
NextGenVest - all students get access to NextGenVest's learning platform

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: incl phone charger, etc. in gift box
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: NextGenVest - premium membership to all winners
Wheelhouse - all participants get free access seats to GitHub for Developers course

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Wheelhouse is awarding a Lunch and Learn Session with Co-Founder, Nikolai Chowdhury, who will talk and share thoughts on a "Toolkit for Modern Software Development" over lunch in their NYC Office at Grand Central Tech.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Wheelhouse - winning "Advanced Team" lunch and learn session

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Team will present what they made, meet founders & developers, talk about Hopscotch (a programming language) and how to program, talk about how to get into developing/programming after HS
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Hopscotch - lunch with finalist/winner
Hopscotch - stickers for everyone
